text:
Hi, my name is Emmy, and welcome to the Ray 
Dashboard walkthrough series. In this video,

we're going to take a closer look at the 
job detail page. Within the context of Ray,

a job is a workload started with 
a Ray API such as `ray.init()`.

When I look at my landing page right here, what I 
see is a list of my current running jobs as well

as any jobs that have either finished or failed.
Looking a little deeper, I see the status here as

well as how long it took, a summary of the tasks 
that are running or have run as well as some quick

links to actions such as logs, stack traces, and 
flame graphs. Now let's click into each of these

jobs here to pull up the detail page. There 
are five major sections to this detail page.

There's metadata, tasks progression breakdowns, 
a task timeline, Ray status, as well resource

summary tables, and I'll go through each of these.
Starting at the top with meta data, you see this

repeat of information that you saw on the previous 
page. So you can see how long things are taking,

the status as well as go to these quick actions. 
Next, I have this task progression breakdown,

so what I can do is I can expand this and take a 
look at the status of each of my tasks that are in

this job. So if I have any hanging that's going 
on or any failed tasks, I can debug from there.

There's also this task timeline feature, so what 
I can do is for a given job, I can download the

trace file and with the Perfetto UI, I can drag 
and drop this JSON file, and I can take a look

at this really nice timeline visualization 
for what's going on with my particular job.

If I head back, I can now see statuses, so 
if you're using the CLI, you would access

this by using `ray status`, but here you 
have it automatically listed for you. So

you have node status as well as resource status.
And finally, there are summary tables for tasks,

actors, and placement groups. So I can expand 
any of these, and I can quickly find the logs

of what I'm interested in for my tasks, my 
actors, and placement groups wherever relevant.

Those are the main features of the jobs page. If 
you're interested in looking at the other views,

we have different videos in this series 
for you to check out. Thanks for watching!
